H0.text: Pulley is a simple machine that consists of a rope and grooved wheel.

H1.text: Axle is the term for a simple machine that consists of a rope and a grooved wheel.

H2.text: Lever is the simple machine that consists of a rope and a grooved wheel.

H3.text: Pedal is a simple machine that consists of a rope and a grooved wheel.

A4.text: A pulley is a wheel on an axle or shaft enabling a taut cable or belt passing over the wheel to move and change direction.

A5.text: He realized that a lever, pulley, and wheel and axle are in essence the same device: a body rotating about a hinge.

A6.text: The wheel and axle are in essence the same device: a body rotating about a hinge.

A7.text: A block and tackle system amplifies the tension force in the rope to lift heavy loads.

A8.text: Its mechanical advantage is the number of parts of the rope that act on the load.
